subject: College Athletics
Football
lead_paragraph: Missouri Coach Gary Pinkel will receive a $550,000 annual raise, boosting his guaranteed compensation to $1.85 million a year, Athletic Director Mike Alden announced. Pinkel also gets a one-year extension through 2012. Late last season, he was given a $225,000 raise and three-year extension. The announcement comes as No. 7 Missouri (11-2) prepares to face No. 25 Arkansas (8-4) in the Cotton Bowl on Jan. 1 in Dallas.Pinkel, 55, is in his seventh season at Missouri, which was briefly ranked No. 1 in the Bowl Championship Series standings before losing the Big 12 title game to Oklahoma in December.Pinkel is 48-37 at Missouri and 121-74-3 in 17 seasons over all.
